articles.title: Ground-breaking Ceremony Held for Construction of Mansudae Area
articles.content:
Ground-breaking Ceremony Held for Construction of Mansudae Area
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A ground-breaking ceremony was held on the spot Sunday for building Mansudae area on the best level on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The successful construction of modern apartment houses and monumental edifices in Mansudae area where the statue of the President stands as required by the new century and the conversion of the area around it into a huge park would bring about big progress in turning Pyongyang into a world-class city and a magnificent city for people.
					
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Kim Yong Chun and other senior officials and officials of ministries and national institutions and in Pyongyang and tens of thousands of builders.
					
					 Premier Choe Yong Rim in his report said that leader Kim Jong Il initiated the above-said construction project and took revolutionary measures for undertaking the project ranging from its design to the provision of manpower for the project and supply of materials. 
					
					 He called on the officials and builders to fully meet the requirements of designing and construction and its methods under the slogan "Let Us Take Responsibility for the Safety of the Projects and Guarantee Their Absolute Quality for All Eternity!" and thus ensure the highest quality of all structures.
					
					 He also called upon all officials and builders to become honorable victors in the general offensive for carrying out the above-said project under the guidance of the great party, holding aloft the slogan "When Korea is Determined, It Can Do Anything!"
					
					 Yang In Guk, director of the Capital Construction Bureau, Kim Thae Bong, minister of Metal Industry, and Ho Song Gil, manager of the Sangwon Cement Complex, in their speeches evinced their determination to contribute to completing ahead of schedule the most gigantic and worthwhile project in the history of city construction in terms of its style and contents and period of the construction.

articles.title: Seminar of International Communists Adopts Resolution on Korea
articles.content:
Seminar of International Communists Adopts Resolution on Korea
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The 20th seminar of international communists was held in Belgium between May 13 and 15.
					 It was attended by delegates of at least 50 communist and workers' parties from over 40 countries including the DPRK, Russia, Cuba, Vietnam, Belarus, Ukraine, Denmark, Democratic Congo, Egypt, Peru and Brazil.
					
					 The seminar discussed ways of further enhancing the role of the above-said parties under the present international situation and exchanged experience gained by each party and adopted a series of documents.
					
					 A resolution on Korea adopted at the seminar vehemently condemned the moves of the U.S. imperialists to provoke a war of aggression against the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 The resolution supported the June 15 joint declaration in 2000, the October 4 declaration in 2007 and the joint statement of the government, political parities and organizations of the DPRK.
					
					 It demanded the U.S. conclude a peace agreement with the DPRK and put a definite end to the Korean War.
					
					 It wished the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people success in their struggle for peace on the Korean Peninsula, Northeast Asia and the rest of the world and extended firm solidarity to them.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Accuses Authorities of Bringing Inter-Korean Relations to Collapse
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Accuses Authorities of Bringing Inter-Korean Relations to Collapse
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- South Korean newspaper Hangyore on May 19 editorially denounced the present puppet authorities for bringing the inter-Korean relations to a collapse.
					 The editorial recalled that one year has passed since the authorities took the "May 24 measure" of totally suspending exchange between the south and the north right after the "Cheonan" case.
					
					 This measure not only brought the inter-Korean relations to a collapse but the businesses that participated in the cooperation undertakings with the north went bankrupt en masse, it said, and went on:
					
					 The successes made between the south and the north in the past prove that cooperation and exchange only provide a way out for all.
					
					 It accused the authorities of turning their faces away from the road of common prosperity with the north and only heading for ruin.

articles.title: S. Korean Lawmaker from Opposition Party Chides Appointment of Only Old Acquaintances to "Government" Posts
articles.content:
S. Korean Lawmaker from Opposition Party Chides Appointment of Only Old Acquaintances to "Government" Posts
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A lawmaker from the Democratic Party, an opposition party, on May 18 chided the present "government" for appointing old acquaintances only to its posts, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 He made it clear that there are many suspicions about the informal designation of Ryu Yong Suk as a candidate for the minister of Environment with a confirmation hearing at hand.
					
					 He disclosed the fact that Ryu as a church-goer has made a big donation to the Somang Church with Lee Myung Bak as a superior priest.
					
					 This fact proves that only those who go that church can become ministers under the present regime, he held.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Stage Coordinated Firing Drill for Preemptive Attack on DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Lawmaker from Opposition Party Chides Appointment of Only Old Acquaintances to "Government" Posts
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A lawmaker from the Democratic Party, an opposition party, on May 18 chided the present "government" for appointing old acquaintances only to its posts, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 He made it clear that there are many suspicions about the informal designation of Ryu Yong Suk as a candidate for the minister of Environment with a confirmation hearing at hand.
					
					 He disclosed the fact that Ryu as a church-goer has made a big donation to the Somang Church with Lee Myung Bak as a superior priest.
					
					 This fact proves that only those who go that church can become ministers under the present regime, he held.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Racket for Confrontation of Systems under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Racket for Confrontation of Systems under Fire
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- During his recent German junket traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea impudently urged the north to "dismantle its nukes," asserting that "they are obstructive to unification" and the like. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					 What he uttered is an unpardonable political provocation to the DPRK as it revealed once again the criminal attempt to dare to disarm the DPRK by pressurizing "the north to dismantle nukes first" and realize the ambition for "unification under liberal democracy."
					
					 The above-said racket kicked up by the south Korean conservative group is an undisguised negation of the ideology and system of the fellow countrymen and a treacherous act to realize the above-said ambition, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The ultimate aim sought by the south Korean authorities in the said confrontation is to ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 The spate of reckless remarks made by Lee even during his foreign trip at a time when the above-said confrontation has gone into extremes in south Korea is little short of a declaration of a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK does not want to see the total collapse of the inter-Korean relations but will never allow the Lee group to escalate the racket for confrontation of the systems, opposed to the reunification by federal formula stipulated in the north-south joint declaration and decisively foil it.
					
					It is no more than a foolish daydream for the south Korean conservative group to try to get something through the racket in a ridiculous anticipation of "contingency".

articles.title: Bangladeshi Newspaper Calls for Peace and Security on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Newspaper Calls for Peace and Security on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The May 15th issue of the Bangladeshi newspaper Natun Katha carried an article titled "Korea's Reunification and Idea of By Korean Nation Itself" on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The paper in the article said that more than a decade has passed since the publication of the said joint declaration but the idea of "By the Korean nation itself", the basic spirit of the declaration, is still shining as an invariable banner for Korea's reunification.
					
					 Korea was divided not by any contradictions among Koreans but by foreign forces, the paper said, adding:
					
					 Korea's reunification is an issue that should be solved by the concerted efforts of the Koreans, who are responsible for reunification, in line with their will and requirements, and there is, therefore, neither reason nor justification for foreign forces to interfere in it.
					
					 Peace and security on the Korean Peninsula precisely mean peace and security of the world and if a war breaks out on the peninsula it will inevitably develop into a thermonuclear war which mankind has never experienced. 
					
					 The implementation of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration is the only way for achieving the reunification of the peninsula.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Meeting with Seyed Ali Khamenei Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Meeting with Seyed Ali Khamenei Marked
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A Korean photo exhibition, a film show and round-table talks were held at the Iran-Korea Friendship Magsal Agro-Stock Farm on May 17 to mark the 22nd anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's meeting with Seyed Ali Khamenei, leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran.
					 On display in the venue of the events were photos of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il providing field guidance to the work in different fields of the national economy.
					
					 Among those present at the events were personages and employees of the farm and the DPRK ambassador to Iran and his embassy officials.
					
					 The participants of the events looked round photos on display and watched the Korean film "HE Seyed Ali Khamenei, President of the Islamic Republic of Iran, Visits Our Country".
					
					 The manager of the farm in his speech at the round-table talks praised Kim Il Sung as a great man who recorded a great chapter in the history of world politics.
					
					 He said that the Iranian people would always remember the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung for the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the peoples of the two countries standing together on the common front of the struggle against imperialism and the U.S. would grow stronger, he stressed.

articles.title: Russian President Calls for Development of Nuclear Force to Counter European Missile Shield
articles.content:
Russian President Calls for Development of Nuclear Force to Counter European Missile Shield
 Moscow, May 20 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev warned the West over the issue of the European missile shield at a press interview on May 18.
					 There are issues to be agreed upon between Russia and NATO, he noted, adding that if no agreement is reached between the two, Russia will be left with no option but to take countermeasures.
					
					 Clarifying that this means Russia will go ahead with its plan to develop the nuclear offensive potential and if this happens, it will spark another Cold War.

articles.title: Afghans Protest against Killing of Civilians by NATO
articles.content:
Afghans Protest against Killing of Civilians by NATO
						
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Afghans in Taluqan City of Takhar Province went to the street Wednesday to protest the killing of four civilians by NATO-led troops. 
					 At least 2 000 people staged a demonstration Wednesday morning in protest against NATO-led troops' killing of four civilians including two women during a raid outside Taluqan City.
					
					 The protestors said that the troops had arrested two more civilians during the raid.
					
					 Chanting anti-government and anti-NATO slogans, the protesters called on the government to punish those responsible for the killing of non-combatant citizens.

articles.title: Iran Terms U.S. New Sanctions Psychological Warfare
articles.content:
ran Terms U.S. New Sanctions Psychological Warfare
 Tehran, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Minister of Economic Affairs and Finance in an interview with satellite Press TV on May 18 clarified the stand of his government vehemently rejecting the U.S. new sanctions against his country.
					 On Tuesday, the U.S. Treasury Department decided to impose sanctions on an Iranian state-owned bank. In this regard he branded it as a psychological warfare against his country.
					
					 He referred to the numerous efforts made by different U.S. administrations to enforce Washington's "hegemonic position" against the Islamic Republic, saying that anti-Iran sanctions are the continuation of such policies.

articles.title: Incompetence of S. Korean Puppet Government Ridiculed
articles.content:
Incompetence of S. Korean Puppet Government Ridiculed
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News on May 19 carried an article ridiculing the incompetence of the puppet government.
					 The housing conditions of most people have worsened under the Lee Myung Bak regime, the article said, and continued:
					
					 The regime has taken 47 measures for solving the issue of real estate over the past three years and three months but they proved futile.
					
					 "The housing project for cradle" billed as the core of the housing policy, in particular, only caused a sharp rise in the money for the lease of houses, it noted.
					
					 The number of people left without shelter is now on the increase, it said, deploring that the regime's measures for settling the issue of real estate are ridiculous.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Russia and Indonesia
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Russia and Indonesia
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A 6.2-magnitude earthquake hit eastern coastal area of Kamchatka, Russia on May 19.
					 The epicenter was the waters off the area.
					
					 A 6.1-maginitude earthquake jolted Java Island of Indonesia on May 17.
					
					 The epicenter was 170 km southeast from Blitar, East Java Province.

articles.title: Gravity-fed Waterways in DPRK Introduced by Russian Internet Magazine
articles.content:
Gravity-fed Waterways in DPRK Introduced by Russian Internet Magazine
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) ?- The Russian Internet magazine "Liv Zurnal" on May 16 carried an article titled "Construction of Gravity-fed Waterways in DPRK".
					 The article referred to the fact that the projects of the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong Waterway, the Paekma-Cholsan Waterway and the Miru Plain Waterway were completed in a short span of time in the DPRK in the new century.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The construction of these waterways helped consolidate the material and technological foundation for boosting the agricultural production in the DPRK and bring about a change in the use of land in the country.
					
					 It led to saving a lot of electricity used for pumping water.
					
					 The above-said waterways are providing water for industrial and household uses, contributing to economic construction and peopleâ€™s living. They, at the same time, are making the landscape of areas more beautiful by meandering along high and low mountains, hills and roads.
					
					 These waterways completed under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il are bringing bigger benefits to the industrious Korean people.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Burial of Defoliant Exposed by S. Korean Media
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Burial of Defoliant Exposed by S. Korean Media
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the U.S. forces present in south Korea buried defoliant in their base in Waegwan, Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province in 1978, Kyunghyang Daily News, Hangook Ilbo and other south Korean media said.
					 This was disclosed by three ex-soldiers, who served at the U.S. military base in south Korea in those days, over a broadcasting service in Arizona State, the U.S. on May 16.
					
					 They said that they buried in the land of the base 250 drums containing defoliant by an order of their officer.
					
					 The quantity of the buried defoliant was 50 tons.
					
					 Recalling that after being driven to the burial work, rashes were seen on their whole bodies and their feet were so paralyzed that they were unable to walk, they testified to the fact that they are still  suffering from chronic arthritis, mental disorder, etc. though more than three decades have passed since then.

articles.title: Fund-raising Campaign for Afflicted Compatriots Staged
articles.content:
Fund-raising Campaign for Afflicted Compatriots Staged
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A fund-raising campaign is brisk in different parts of Japan to help the compatriots hard hit by a killer earthquake and ensuing tsunami in Japan.
					 All the officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and compatriots have conducted the fund-raising campaign involving its organizations and all compatriots, considering it as an important task of the 90-day campaign to give collective support and assistance to the organizations and compatriots in the afflicted areas.
					
					 The Chongryon organizations in different parts of Japan called upon compatriots to turn out in the campaign, showing videos dealing with the damage and distributing literature on it among them.
					
					 Kang Sang Hyon, chairman of the Central Standing Management Board of the Korean Youth Commercial Association in Japan, and other representatives visited the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon and handed to it the relief fund raised by the successive chairmen and members.
					
					 Pae Man Sok, chairman of the Miyagi Prefectural Commercial Association, donated a lot of money with the enthusiasm to take the lead in the work to eradicate the aftermath of the earthquake.
					
					 Korean football players also raised relief fund to help afflicted compatriots.
					
					 The Hokkaido Headquarters, the Nishi Kobe branch of the Hyogo Prefecture and the Adachi Branch of Tokyo Metropolis of Chongryon sent a lot of fund to the afflicted areas.
					
					 Meanwhile, compatriots of Mindan-lining organizations and unaffiliated organizations donated relief fund in response to the above-said campaign.

articles.title: Books Off Press in China to Mark Its Party's Birthday
articles.content:
Books Off Press in China to Mark Its Party's Birthday
 Beijing, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Liberation Army Publishing House has published books of over 40 kinds and reprinted those of at least 80 kinds up to now since late in 2010 in celebration of the 90th birthday of the Communist Party of China. 
					 The manager of the publishing house said that those books vividly show the glorious history of the party as valuable historical data.

articles.title: China Supports Non-aligned Movement
articles.content:
China Supports Non-aligned Movement 
 Beijing, May 20 (KCNA) -- Jiang Yu, spokeswoman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry, on May 19 clarified China's stance supporting the non-aligned movement at a press conference.
					 As regards the 16th ministerial meeting of the NAM soon to be opened, she said that China would dispatch its high-level government official to the meeting, adding that it has invariably valued and backed it.
					
					 China hopes that it will provide developing countries with an opportunity to boost the unity and cooperation among them, she stressed.

articles.title: Putin Proposes to Reestablish Sports Schools
articles.content:
Putin Proposes to Reestablish Sports Schools 
 Moscow, May 20 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin proposed to reestablish sports schools at a meeting of the Standing Committee of the Russian Council for the Development of Physical Culture and Sports on May 16.
					 He said that there was an effective system to select and train children skilled in sports in the country 20 years ago and the system was based on about 300 sports schools.
					
					 There are less than 10 similar schools nationwide at present, he noted, stressing the need to reestablish the system for training reserve sportspersons by way of setting up such schools again in all parts of the country, etc.

articles.title: Enlarged Meeting of Council of Ministers Held in Cuba
articles.content:
Enlarged Meeting of Council of Ministers Held in Cuba 
 Havana, May 20 (KCNA) -- An enlarged meeting of the Council of Ministers was held in Cuba recently with Raul Castro, president of the Council of State, attending.
					 The meeting discussed the issue of implementing its 2011 economic plan.
					
					 It decided to bolster the production sectors of the country and increase the export of sugar and its by-products to cope with the soaring prices of food and fuel worldwide.

articles.title: ASEAN Defense Ministers Meeting Held in Indonesia
articles.content:
ASEAN Defense Ministers Meeting Held in Indonesia
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The 5th ASEAN Defense Ministers Meeting (ADMM) held in Jakarta on Thursday discussed various issues in the region such as terrorism, piracy and other maritime security issues.
					 The meeting adopted the Concept Paper on Establishing ASEAN Defense Industry Collaboration and a concept paper on the establishment of an ASEAN peacekeeping centers network.

articles.title: American Tried in UAE
articles.content:
American Tried in UAE 
 Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- A judge in the United Arab Emirates on Thursday sentenced an American to one month in jail for being in possession of police handcuffs.
					 Adam Foster, 30, of Burdett, New York, had been detained for more than two months in the UAE on charges of stealing handcuffs of a Dubai police station.
